name: Orzo, Feta and Tomato Traybake
author: Anna Jones
ingredients:
- 4 red onions, peeled and cut into thin wedges
- 1 red chilli
- 1 red pepper, deseeded and chopped
- 1 head of arlic, cut across the middle
- olive oil
- 400g tin of plum tomatoes
- 1 tsp nigella seeds
- 1 tsp coriander seeds, crushed
- 250g orzo
- 200g feta or vegan feta-style cheese, crumbled
- 1/2 bunch coriader leaves (15g)
- 1/2 bunch parsley leaves (15g)
- 2 tbsp toasted pine nuts
instructions:
- Preheat the oven to 200C. Put the peeled red onion wedges into a large deep-sided baking tray with 1 whole red chilli, 1 chopped red pepper and 1 head of garlic, halved. Drizzle with a splash of olive oil and roast in the oven for 20 minutes until the onions are cooked and the edges of the pepper are beginning to char.
- Drain a tin of tomatoes and keep the juice. Put the tomatoes into the baking tray with 1 tsp nigella seeds and 1 tsp crushed coriander seeds, then put the tray back into the oven for another 20 minutes so the tomatoes can roast and intensify.
- Take the tray out of the oven and use the back of a wooden spoon or a potato masher to break up the tomatoes. Take the garlic out and squeeze it from it's skins into the tray.
- Put the tomato juice into a measuring jug and top of with boiling water until you have 800ml liquid. Add to the tray with 250g orzo and dot the top with the crumbled feta. Return the tray to the oven for 15 minutes, stirring it all halfway through, until the orzo is cooked.
- Take the tray out of the oven and shower with the coriander and parsley leaves, the pine nutes and a drizzle of oil.
